body:
I'll look into it tomorrow. Isn't it enough to set the cookie to false and refresh the page?

Sent from my iPhone

> On Feb 19, 2019, at 6:26 PM, Adrian Cole <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> ok so let me ask another way then.
> 
> of people offering for us to do more work.. who is offering to do it? and
> revert it back later?
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you commented.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
@drolando yes, but you will still need a control for that somewhere. I didn't see an obvious place that wouldn't clutter the new UI which without this revision request would be lacking said clutter.
releasing anyway as #2404 scope just grew

I'm fine with merging as is and add the other button in another pr

Sent from my iPhone

> On Feb 19, 2019, at 6:37 PM, Adrian Cole <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> @drolando yes, but you will still need a control for that somewhere. I didn't see an obvious place that wouldn't clutter the new UI which without this revision request would be lacking said clutter.
> 
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
@drolando thanks for stepping up. I'll merge this, then as that will let folks building from master or using snapshots give it a try.

what this smells like is v1 json encoding 1 instead of true for the "sa"
binary annotation.. could that be the case? in thrift boolean true is
encoded as a byte with one bit set..

>
>   {
>     "traceId": "7309633b16097a5c",

>

>     "id": "4f829b6d0eb7bfb5",
>     "kind": "SERVER",
>     "name": "post /path_info_in_here_edited_out",
>     "timestamp": 1551123015539229,
>     "duration": 999430,

>
> Note how the SA notation is alone in a different section of the JSON even
> when they have the same ID.
>
> I assume the UI is rendering any one of the other depending on the orther
> it finds this information. Thus it gets an annotation with no further info
> and gets renderingg this way.
>
> This traces are being sent by the zipkin-ruby tracer. I suspect a bug
> there, but please verify.
> Zipkin-ruby does *not* have support for v2 traces yet which can be the
> root of this.
>
> If you determine this is a bug in the current UI, I do not care really as
> long as Lens do not have the same bug as we will migrate as soon as it is
> available in the stable image.
>

> .

"sa" aside it looks like the span is sent in two documents instead of one.
it is odd that the IP address would change during the same request on the
same host. usually that is symptomatic of a loopback RPC. Even if it
weren't, we would have to guess which side of the RPC to stick the extra
span doc (the client or the server side).

thanks for posting.. will think about it. meanwhile if there is a way to
keep stable endpoint info and post a single doc instead of two that will be
good anyway.

We are hardcoding `sa` to `1` somehow we thought that was the way. We'll change that to `true` (boolean or the string "true"?) if you can verify.
More weird still, I've looked at the code and I see where we set the `sa`, it is in the client span, which in fact it is in the trace also. At that point in the code there are other annotations, and they do show up:

```
  {
    "traceId": "7309633b16097a5c",
    "parentId": "4f829b6d0eb7bfb5",
    "id": "d1887feaeb2591de",
    "kind": "CLIENT",
    "name": "post",
    "timestamp": 1551123015543929,
    "duration": 993347,
    "localEndpoint": {
      "serviceName": "hermes-sandbox",
      "ipv4": "172.17.0.20",
      "port": 3000
    },
    "tags": {
      "http.method": "POST",
      "http.path": "/v1/protocol_versions/94365fe0-d84d-4ed7-af48-3991b12bde4a/publish",
      "http.status": "200",
      "sa": "1"
    }
  },
```

and nowhere else the sa is setup, so really no idea where this particular sa with no extra info comes from.

So to summarize, we have 3 pieces here , a SERVER, a CLIENT, both I can find in the client code. And a SA which has no extra info which I can't find.
Also we have the SA == 1 thing which if you tell me so I'll change to the boolean true.

> We are hardcoding sa to 1 somehow we thought that was the way. We'll
change that to true (boolean or the string "true"?) if you can verify.

definitely boolean true (even if string might work)
https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin-api/blob/master/zipkin-api.yaml#L298

not sure.. maybe when late route info is sent.

> So to summarize, we have 3 pieces here , a SERVER, a CLIENT, both I can
> find in the client code. And a SA which has no extra info which I can't
> find.
> Also we have the SA == 1 thing which if you tell me so I'll change to the
> boolean true.
>
So, the reason why the "sa" gets separated is  "sa" means "server address"
and that is a client attribute. "sa" should never be set on a server span.
So, when the attribute is sent standalone, the parser assumes this is a
client span, as if a remote address in v1 format was set on a server span,
it would be "ca" (client address) not "sa" (server address)

obv doing native v2 encoding would be  a win at some point (nudge nudge) as
that gets rid of the whole awkwardness and confusion around "sa" etc, as
remoteAddress is harder to get wrong.

The only place where I see SA  set is here

```
        span.record_tag(Trace::BinaryAnnotation::METHOD, method.upcase, Trace::BinaryAnnotation::Type::STRING, local_endpoint)
        span.record_tag(Trace::BinaryAnnotation::PATH, url.path, Trace::BinaryAnnotation::Type::STRING, local_endpoint)
        span.record_tag(Trace::BinaryAnnotation::SERVER_ADDRESS, SERVER_ADDRESS_SPECIAL_VALUE, Trace::BinaryAnnotation::Type::BOOL, remote_endpoint)
        span.record(Trace::Annotation::CLIENT_SEND, local_endpoint)
        response = @app.call(env).on_complete do |renv|
          record_response_tags(span, renv[:status].to_s, local_endpoint)
        end
        span.record(Trace::Annotation::CLIENT_RECV, local_endpoint)
```

Which is a client span. I never see it in a server span.
Yeah I want to do V2 also, not enough hands

ok so in the initial example, it looks like maybe the data was missing some of the client part (only getting the "sa" info).. weird. anyway this is more a troubleshooting type of conversation. We should probably not do this in an issue as it spams everyone watching. Let's move to gitter? https://gitter.im/openzipkin/zipkin
It is not missing information, the client span is there, the server span is there, and then there is this extra sa thing which I can't see where is coming from

fwiw personally I am fine with conversions of address keywords ignoring the binary annotation value. As you can see in the image of the original trace, mistaking remote address for local one really wrecks data conversion.
https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/pull/2415 should work around this, but fixing the encoding should go out asap
I tried this and it worked. Note that since conversion happens at ingress, it will only help with new spans. Normal: Lens:

first, the author would need to volunteer to contribute the code.
technically though, this looks like a port of the mysql code, which isn't a
good schema to emulate. so, in its form I dont expect that specific code to
be merged.

>
cc @tacigar
ps @drolando noted offline that probably this could be done in a different way (ex with css). I didn't intend to recommend above, just noting for background

@libeilin before we experiment with a non-OSS feature, can you comment if rollover indexing is desirable? maintaining features has a cost, especially so with non OSS distributions (as it affects how we do testing) so we want to make sure there is user buy-in.

It is also possible for us to explore hourly indexes regardless

can you please send the command that is creating that error? The code
mention exists in 2.0.19.Final, but also many versions prior.

If you run with `java -jar
./zipkin-server/target/zipkin-server-*exec.jar
--logging.level.io.undertow=trace` it will show the request info
leading to that error.

Make sure you are building locally or the latest exec jar from here
http://oss.jfrog.org/oss-snapshot-local/io/zipkin/java/zipkin-server/2.12.3-SNAPSHOT/

Updated this branch and CircleCI passes now. I made one behavior change in that when collector is disabled, it returns 404 instead of 405 - the latter seemed complicated and also surprised me, if the API isn't on shouldn't it be 404? Anyways, hopefully it's a small enough change.

I think there are some more code cleanups possible but at least things are merged and probably working - Travis seems to get stuck on not being able to connect to Cassandra but I'm hoping that's not related to armeria.

will take a look. thanks!

@adriancole I noticed the drift, I think I merged it ok and the integration tests run (admittedly only running the tests, not the UI itself) but did you notice something that doesn't look right related to the dual mounted? Anyways, in no rush so could wait until Tuesday or whenever

> @trustin remember those old APIs? :D

Ohh, that's a very long time ago. :rofl: Never knew you tried to replace Spring Web at that time! I hope we are getting better and better in terms of API usability and user happiness. :crossed_fingers:
Fixed by https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin-ruby/pull/139
Does the trace lookup header have any purpose in this screen?

> Does the trace lookup header have any purpose in this screen?

@jcarres-mdsol do you mean the search bar at the top where you can select criteria to search? If so, I agree it doesn't have a use on this page and could be confusing, but I think it is there for consistency as a global search context. I'm not a designer so not sure what's best to do about it (hide it for this view only? show it as disabled in this view?), but thank you for bringing it up. What do others think? Maybe something to spin off into a separate issue so we don't block adding this functionality that helps bring Lens up to feature parity with the classic UI.

Idea from me: a dropdown button with 2 options: Download and Download With Masking 
Download with Masking will simply mask data with random string (except trace id etc) for display purpose debugging. The logic will be implemented in UI side.

my 2p. masking with random will make certain troubleshooting cases really
difficult especially service names.

I would recommend some other substitution approach, such as Latin words,
for service names. and honor the same shapes for things like http URLs. (ex
same depth and exact cardinality).

things that likely should stay the same are timestamps, duration, span
kind, ports (while replacing IPs consistently)

I'm basically describing what I do manually.

also I think masking is just one filter. you can consider PII redaction as
an independent step. ex masking of phone number or account data is good for
masking.

whatever we do, we should alert the user they are responsible to edit the
file manually before posting anywhere. for example, our masking can take
some heavy lifting out of the process but it is still their responsibility
to not leak data not the responsibility of our UI code.

If it has no use, then should not be there. 
Another option would be to, have a "search traceid" component instead, which is also a functionality in the classic UI.

That would make sense, this would be the place where you look at one single trace, either by searching by its traceid in the storage or uploading it from outside storage

can you give the full stack trace or error message? colon isn't disallowed
until elasticsearch 7
Thank you for your feedback!! I'll take a look.

> whatever we do, we should alert the user they are responsible to edit the file manually before posting anywhere. for example, our masking can take some heavy lifting out of the process but it is still their responsibility to not leak data not the responsibility of our UI code.

I fully agree. We want to make this clearly stated however the feature surfaces.

We don't support custom Zipkin Servers - it is meant to be run as the executable JAR we publish or the Docker container we publish. That said, there are several ways to add-on features depending on what you are trying to accomplish. It will be easier to discuss this on Gitter, so feel free to join us there: https://gitter.im/openzipkin/zipkin
If you want to process the span data somehow before saving, there are folks doing this already and we would be happy to guide you to a solution.
